Package de.oth.blocklib.world.vegetation.trees

Class BiomTree

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.world.vegetation.trees.BiomTree
Direct Known Subclasses:
DesertBiomTree, JungleBiomTree, PlainBiomTree, SavannahBiomTree, TaigaBiomTree
public abstract class BiomTree
extends java.lang.Object
Abstract class for the Trees in a Biom. When creating a new type of tree this class should be extended.
Author:
Julian Sellner

  • Constructor Details

    • BiomTree

      public BiomTree​(short blockId, short leafBlockId, int treeSize, int radius)
      Constructor for Trees which have leafs
      Parameters:
      blockId - id of the tree log id
      leafBlockId - id of the tree leaf
      treeSize - number of the size of the log
      radius - number of the radius of the tree

    • BiomTree

      public BiomTree​(short blockId, int treeSize, int radius)
      Constructor for Trees which do not have leafs
      Parameters:
      blockId - id of the tree log id
      treeSize - number of the size of the log
      radius - number of the radius of the tree

  • Method Details

    • getTreeBlockId

      public short getTreeBlockId()
      This function shows the id the log requires.
      Returns:
      id of tree log block.

    • getLeafBlockId

      public short getLeafBlockId()
      This function shows the id the leaf requires.
      Returns:
      id of leaf block.

    • getRadius

      public int getRadius()
      This function shows the radius of the tree. It so how far it reaches to the x and z coordinates.
      Returns:
      radius of the tree.

    • getTreeSize

      public int getTreeSize()
      This function shows how long the log of the tree will be. The leaf height of the crown is not calculated here.
      Returns:
      the height of the log.

    • buildTreeInChunk

      public abstract void buildTreeInChunk​(PopulatingWorldInterface interaction, Vector3i startVector)
      This function builds trees for the world. All the trees in a Chunk will be saved in a hashmap.
      Parameters:
      startVector - the Vector which marks the root of the tree.
